instruction:
A list of all movies that meet the criteria given should be compiled.

movies directed by Spike Lee by release date
output:
To provide a list of all movies directed by Spike Lee in order of their release date, I have compiled the following list based on the information available:

1. She's Gotta Have It (1986) - This is Spike Lee's first feature-length film, which he wrote, directed, and co-produced.
2. School Daze (1988) - This comedy-drama film is Lee's second movie, focusing on the experiences of African-American students at a historically black college.
3. Do the Right Thing (1989) - This is a comedy-drama film that explores race relations in Brooklyn, New York, on the hottest day of the year.
4. Mo' Better Blues (1990) - This movie is a romantic comedy-drama about a successful jazz musician who struggles with balancing his personal life and career.
5. Jungle Fever (1991) - This romantic drama explores the complexities of interracial relationships in New York City.
6. Malcolm X (1992) - This biographical drama tells the story of the life of civil rights leader Malcolm X, played by Denzel Washington.
7. Clockers (1995) - This crime drama is based on the novel by Richard Price and explores the world of drug dealing in Brooklyn.
8. Girl 6 (1996) - This romantic comedy-drama stars Theresa Randle as a struggling actress who takes on a job as a movie extra to make ends meet.
9. He Got Game (1998) - This sports drama follows a basketball player who is released from prison and must balance his relationship with his son and his love for the game.
10. Bamboozled (2000) - This satirical comedy-drama critiques the state of African-American representation in the media and Hollywood.
11. The Wire (2002-2004) - Although not a film, Lee directed several episodes of this critically acclaimed HBO television series, which explores the drug trade in Baltimore from multiple perspectives.
12. She Hate Me (2004) - This comedy-drama follows a man who becomes a sperm donor for wealthy lesbians, leading to unexpected consequences.
13. Inside Man (2006) - This crime thriller stars Denzel Washington and Clive Owen in a story about a bank heist gone wrong.
14. Miracle at St. Anna (2008) - This war drama is set during World War II and follows a group of African-American soldiers who are trapped behind enemy lines in Italy.
15. Oldboy (2013) - This psychological thriller is a remake of the South Korean film of the same name, about a man who is held captive for 15 years and then suddenly released.
16. Da Sweet Blood of Jesus (2014) - This horror-comedy is a sequel to Lee's 1991 film "Mo' Better Blues" and follows a jazz musician who becomes a vampire.
17. Chi-Raq (2015) - This musical comedy-drama is a modern-day adaptation of Aristophanes' "Lysistrata" and explores the gun violence crisis in Chicago.
18. Black Klansman (2018) - This biographical crime drama is based on the true story of Ron Stallworth, a black police officer who infiltrated the Ku Klux Klan in the 1970s.
19. Da 5 Bloods (2020) - This war drama follows a group of aging Vietnam War veterans who return to the country in search of a lost treasure and grapple with their past experiences.

Please note that this list includes all feature-length films directed by Spike Lee up to Da 5 Bloods (2020).
